intro: Minuartia mesogitana, commonly known as the Aegean rockcress, is a small, flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its cruciform flowers and segmented stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in sunny, arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Minuartia mesogitana is adapted to withstand harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
